sense.name: consecutive happenings
sense.commentary: SERIES[+event] similar things placed in order or happening one after another
sense.examples: They were investigating a series of bank robberies.

sense.name: serial publication
sense.commentary: serial - a periodical that appears at scheduled times
sense.examples: I own the whole X-men series. The Post Office issued a series commemorating famous American entertainers. His coin collection included the complete series of Indian-head pennies.

sense.name: entertainment series
sense.commentary: SERIES[+event] television series - a serialized set of programs
sense.examples: It was the longest running series in history, it lasted ten years. The comedy series was taken off the air after only one month. The Masterworks concert series went on for years.

sense.name: sports: contests
sense.commentary: SERIES[+event] several contests played successively by the same team
sense.examples: The visiting team swept the series. He watched the series every week, like all devoted fans.

sense.name: sum
sense.commentary: the sum of a finite or infinite sequence of expressions
sense.examples: The convergence of a series is related to the convergence of a sequence.

sense.name: connected components
sense.commentary: connection of components in such a manner that current flows first through one and then through the other
sense.examples: The voltage divider consisted of a series of fixed resistors.
